thread.title: Woman allegedly attacked under Silverdale bridge | Stuff.co.nz
thread.title_full: Woman allegedly attacked under Silverdale bridge | Stuff.co.nz

author: Jay Boreham
title: Woman allegedly attacked under Silverdale bridge | Stuff.co.nz
text:
Woman allegedly attacked under Silverdale bridge JAY BOREHAM Last updated 14:46, February 20 2017 Jay Boreham 
The alleged attack occurred beneath Hibiscus Coast overpass at Silverdale. 
Police are investigating an alleged sexual attack on a woman under a north Auckland bridge on Sunday night. 
An unknown man approached the woman on a walkway under an overpass on the Hibiscus Coast Highway in Silverdale around 10.30pm. 
He exposed himself to her and then the victims alleges an assault, a police spokeswoman said. 
"Police are making enquiries into a reported indecent assault. 
"As we are in the early stages of making enquiries into this incident, we are unable to provide any further detail," the spokeswoman said. 
Officers had cordoned off the walkway, running from the Weiti Rest Area on Tavern Rd beneath the highway to Silverdale St, guarded entrances to it while investigations continued this morning. 
Any members of the public who were in the area at the time and witnessed any suspicious activity are asked to contact Orewa Police Station on 09 426 4555. 
Acting bar manager of the nearby Wade Tavern, Christine Hunter, said she had heard nothing of the incident. 
The pub had closed around 10pm and all staff had left by 10.30pm, she said.
